channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: This investor’s Trump basket is up 87% since March. Here’s what he likes now.
item.description: Citrini Research recommends buying every company Lina Khan has spoken negatively about.

item.title: I inherited $200,000. One of my daughters is married with kids, but the other has debts. Do I split my windfall 50/50?
item.description: “She has incurred a lot of debt due to the financial strain of a sick pet, a car loan, student loans and an unpaid military home loan.”

item.title: The Outsider Trying to Restore Citi to Investment-Banking Glory
item.description: Vis Raghavan, Citi’s new banking head, is setting his sights on the buyout kings.

item.title: Why one left-leaning economic policy has ‘broad support’ — even in red states
item.description: Red-state voters easily approved these pro-worker ballot initiatives. The pattern could point to one reason why Donald Trump won the 2024 election.

item.title: OPEC Trims Demand Forecast for Fourth Straight Month
item.description: The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries cut its forecast for oil-demand growth for the fourth consecutive month after further delaying i...

item.title: Trump is ‘the most pro-stock-market president’ America has ever had — here’s why it’s not even close
item.description: Financial markets could benefit from Donald Trump’s second term, says Wharton’s Jeremy Siegel. But they could also serve as a check against certain ex...

item.title: Home Depot’s stock rises toward a record after earnings sweep past estimates
item.description: “While macroeconomic uncertainty remains, our third quarter performance exceeded our expectations,” said Ted Decker, chair, president and CEO, in prep...

item.title: Sterling's Fall After U.K. Jobs Data Likely to Remain Contained
item.description: Sterling’s depreciation after the U.K. employment data should remain limited as the Bank of England is likely to stick to gradual interest rate cuts, ...

item.title: U.S. Stock Futures Dip as Bitcoin Sets Another Record
item.description: S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq-100 futures retreated slightly while crypto-sensitive stocks rose.

item.title: Wall Street Welcomes Back Fatter Bonuses
item.description: Pay for bankers and traders had been weighed down by higher interest rates and economic uncertainty.
